name: Sirius
description: Brightest star in the night sky; nearby A-type star with a white dwarf companion.

name: Canopus
description: Second-brightest star; bright F-type giant used extensively for calibration.

name: Alpha Centauri A
description: Nearest Sun-like star; part of the Alpha Centauri triple system.

name: Alpha Centauri B
description: K-class companion to Alpha Centauri A; important for exoplanet searches.

name: Proxima Centauri
description: Closest known star to the Sun; major target for exoplanet and habitability studies.

name: Arcturus
description: Nearby red giant; extremely luminous and widely studied in stellar evolution research.

name: Vega
description: A0 star historically used as a photometric zero point; highly observed.

name: Capella
description: Nearby bright giant binary; used frequently in stellar astrophysics.

name: Rigel
description: Blue supergiant in Orion; one of the most luminous stars visible to the naked eye.

name: Betelgeuse
description: Red supergiant with dramatic variability; monitored for possible pre-supernova signals.

name: Procyon
description: Nearby F-type star with a white dwarf companion; used in astrophysical calibrations.

name: Aldebaran
description: Bright giant star in Taurus; major target for variability and exoplanet searches.

name: Spica
description: Massive and close binary system; heavily studied through spectroscopy.

name: Fomalhaut
description: Nearby A-type star with a prominent debris disk; central to exoplanet research.

name: Antares
description: Red supergiant with complex mass loss; major target for massive-star studies.

name: Altair
description: Nearby fast-rotating A-type star exhibiting gravity darkening.

name: Deneb
description: One of the most luminous stars known; apex of the Summer Triangle.

name: Barnard's Star
description: High proper-motion red dwarf; extremely well monitored for exoplanets.

name: Pollux
description: K-type giant and confirmed exoplanet host.

name: Castor
description: Triple star system, historically important to binary-star studies.

name: Regulus
description: Rapidly rotating B-type star; heavily studied for stellar oblateness.

name: Shaula
description: Bright B-type system at the tail of Scorpius.

name: Bellatrix
description: Blue giant; one of Orion’s main stars, well observed.

name: Mimosa
description: Bright star in Crux; frequently used in studies of blue giants.

name: Acrux
description: Brightest star in Crux; important in southern-sky observations.

name: Elnath
description: Bright B-type giant; reference point in Taurus.

name: Alnitak
description: Massive blue supergiant; part of Orion’s Belt.

name: Alnilam
description: Extremely luminous blue supergiant; middle star of Orion’s Belt.

name: Mintaka
description: Multiple star system in Orion’s Belt.

name: Sadr
description: Bright F8 supergiant in the heart of Cygnus.

name: Alphard
description: K-type giant; solitary and heavily studied for stellar chemistry.

name: Nunki
description: Bright B-type star in Sagittarius.

name: Zeta Puppis
description: Extremely luminous O-type supergiant with strong stellar winds.

name: Naos
description: Massive O-type supergiant; one of the hottest visible stars.

name: Adhara
description: Bright B-type giant; major calibration star.

name: Mirfak
description: Bright supergiant in Perseus; part of the Alpha Persei cluster.

name: Alpheratz
description: Bright A/B-type binary at the corner of Andromeda.

name: Gacrux
description: Bright red giant marking the top of the Southern Cross.

name: Kochab
description: Orange giant; historical pole star.

name: Pherkad
description: Companion to Kochab; part of Ursa Minor.

name: Rasalhague
description: Bright A-type giant in Ophiuchus.

name: Sirius B
description: White dwarf companion to Sirius A; heavily studied in stellar remnant research.

name: Altinak
description: Part of Orion's belt; massive multiple system.

name: Saiph
description: Bright supergiant in Orion.

name: Mu Cephei
description: Massive red hypergiant; known as the Garnet Star.

name: RW Cephei
description: Enormous red supergiant with extreme variability.

name: VY Canis Majoris
description: One of the largest known stars; major target for massive-star evolution.
